Reviews.Content: Another lovely stay at the Hotel Helvetia, on Venice Lido. Much nicer than staying in the crowds, but only 10 minutes across the lagoon to St. Mark's Square. It's like 2 holidays in one. The staff at the Helvetia are so friendly, and always have time to answer your questions. The place is immaculate, and it was delightful having breakfast in the garden this time. Looking forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for short stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BoonyPerth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed 2 days pre and post cruise at this Hotel. The location provides a quiet and relaxed base and easy access to the tourist hot spots. Lido and the area adjacent to the hotel is clean, safe and has a relaxed,seaside feel. The staff at the Hotel were friendly,helpful and welcoming. Our room on the 4th floor was clean, well maintained and comfortable. The hotel has a quaint, old world charm and the staff seemed justifiably proud of its 3 star status. Breakfast was provided in a lovely dining room and again the service was friendly and warm. Although not a huge selection there was always plenty to eat and it was fresh and nicely presented. We would certainly recommend this friendly hotel to those looking for a good value, comfortable option out of the hussle and bustle but with good access.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: cutiegirl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights in May. We booked a prepaid non-refundable double room online through their website for about 75â‚¬ per night including breakfast. Our reason for visiting Venice was to go kayaking and our trips left from the Lido so we only searched for hotels on that island. Helevtia's prices were very competitive and the included breakfast made it one of the least expensive options. We were a day late arriving because we missed our train from Paris, so arrived at the hotel around 10:30AM. We were offered breakfast (which is served until 10:30AM in the dining room) before checking in. The breakfast was very good; continental style with eggs, cold cuts, cheese, preserves, fruit, yoghurt, cereal, juices, tea and coffee... The dining room staff were very friendly and the selection of foods was good. Our room was on the second floor. It was small but comfortable, the bathroom was quite large with shower and bidet. Room was quiet, especially with patio door and shutters closed. The front desk staff were helpful, giving us some restaurant recommendations and transit info. We got to know them quite well as you must leave your room key at the desk when you go out! The location is great, right on the main street (it's not a very busy street!) and only about 2 blocks from the vaporetto stops. I would recommend, especially if you are able to book in advance and pre-pay.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bubbles1612
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself went to Venice with our friends for 3 nights. Having looked at the prices of hotels on Venice Island we decided on the cheaper option of Venice Lido - what a great decision. The hotel is literally a 2 minute walk from the boat stop, just across the road. The hotel staff were very friendly on arrival and showed us directly to our rooms. Our room was small but had a goodl view over to St Marks Square (we were on the 4th floor, room 57). The room was clean and tidy, just what you need for a short break. The beach is only a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel, at the other end of the street. As it was early May when we visited it was quiet but I bet it would be very busy at the height of the season. The hotel is situated on the main street street with plenty of bars and restaurants close by but still quiet on an evening. The nightlife was limited, bars closing around 11 p.m. but we did find a bar that was open until 2 a.m. (not that we stayed that late). Staying on the Lido was an excellent decision as during the day you could get a ferry over to the hustle and bustle of Venice, packed with tourists and on an evening relax on the quiet Lido. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Venice - well worth the money - not 5 Star but it has everything needed for a City Break. The breakfast was included and consisted of ham, cheese, scrambled eggs and the usual breads and pastries. The orange juice is delicious. A great way to start the day. Be prepared - take plenty of money as Venice is very very expensive - but the sights are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean ...”
Reviews.Author: surrealistka
Reviews.Content: Very friendly place on the island of Lido (Venice night shelters). Ideal for individual tourists. Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms very clean and functional. Good breakfast. The downside is very little parking. Generally OK. I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Awful Awful”
Reviews.Author: waveslave1080
Reviews.Content: We booked online at 40 Euro a night for a double room. When we arrived they said the CC had been declined. They were extremely rude, even after we discovered they had entered the expiry date incorrectly. They only had a more expensive room available (75 euro) and as it was late we had no option than to stay. The new room was actually two single beds not a double as they had stated. When I asked them why they hadn't called me (as I had placed my phone number on the booking and even left a message saying we were on our way and would arrive at 9pm) the very rude man said "We don't waste money on phone calls to declined credit cards." I was disgusted by their contempt of customers or potential customers. If the service hadn't been so bad and the room a double as stated, it would have been fine... But instead, it was unpleasant. Venice itself was stunning though... just the most beautfiul, haunting city... throw away the map and get lost away from the main tourist throng... I would advise to stay on venice and pay a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kclaudia
Reviews.Content: I thought the Hotel Helvetia was great value, especially when I later saw the much smaller rooms I had booked in Florence and Rome. I stayed in room 45, a single room on the third floor (there's an elevator) with a comfortable double bed, desk, armoire, and luggage stand/coat rack. The bathroom with shower was small but clean and modern. The hotel's laundry service is expensive but came in handy for getting my jeans washed and pressed (which cost 6 euros). The front desk staff were friendly and helpful, especially the two women who were there in the daytime. The breakfast buffet is generous, and when I had to leave before 7:00 a.m. on my last day, the desk arranged for me to be able to grab a quick cappuccino and roll before going. The hotel is a few steps from the vaporetto stop, and boats come by frequently. On the main street the hotel faces, I had no luck finding a decent restaurant that wasn't a tourist trap. I had better luck going down one of the side streets, where more of the locals eat and shop, or you can find more options in the main part of Venice and then take the boat back to Lido. Everything else is very handy to the hotel--the supermarket up the street a bit, the post office around the back, and tobacco stands across the street selling stamps and everything else. All in all, I really liked the hotel and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, compact and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Crochetcymru
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Helvetia is just a short distance from the water bus stop so it is easy to reach St Marks Square. Our room, number 33, was very compact. There was very little room to move in the bathroom and the toilet was only inches from the wall. The walls seemed very thin as we could hear lots of sounds from the next room. The room was very clean and fine for a short stay. Breakfast was adequate. I agree with previous comments about the coffee, I couldn't drink it. I would recommend the hotel as a good value base to anyone wanting to explore Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-terrible coffee”
Reviews.Author: AnonUK_9
Reviews.Content: The rooms are old fashioned, but clean. There was air conditioning but it hadn't been switched on before we arrived so the room was alittle stuffy. The bathroom was large- which is unusal for hotel bathrooms- and the shower was decent enough to wake you up in the morning. Basic TV set - the only english channel was CNN. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room we stayed in was on the street side and was therefore occasionally noisey. Breakfast was a choice of ham, cheese, jam, tea, coffee (which was really really awful) and orange juice. The hotel is in a perfect location near the vaperetto stop and is an Idea getaway from the narrow streets of Venice. There are a few decent restaurants close to the hotel and the main street is nice to have a post-dinner stroll on. Considering the price (and the average cost of hotels in Venice) the hotel offers value for money and does what it says on the tin.

Reviews.Title: “Great break from the main island!”
Reviews.Author: Exchangers
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel were adequate. Free breakfast. Very helpful staff. Close to the water taxis. I would definitely recommend staying on this island. It's a lot quieter and a nice break. The beach is also great. Not crowded at all. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - beware of fine print though”
Reviews.Author: WorldHopperEU
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 4 bedded room with our children. The rooms (and in fact the hotel as a whole) are quite old-stylish, but clean. Rooms are air conditioned, which is essential in summer months. Bathroom is ok and clean. Minimum service (no minibar, no room-service, basic TV set - remember to ask for the remote when you check in!), but English proficient and relatively friendly and helpful staff. The room we stayed in was on the street side and was therefore quite noisy (windows vibrate with busses/truck pass by, and voices/noise from next door's bar terrace) - I was advised do ask for a "quite room" next time. A nice backyard is used as breakfast space. Buffet offers relatively limited choice (ham, cheese, jam, tea, coffee and -bad- orange juice as well as some danish) Be aware that yoghurt and fruit are charged extra, depending on your room rate! (we had booked a promotional web-price - and they charged us 2 euros per yoghurt!!) It also offers wireless Internet access only at the outrageous price of 12 euros per day.. The hotel is ideally located on the main streets, with tens of shopping and eating places to choose from, and walking distance to both venice boats (be aware that it will cost you 7 eur per ticket!) and to the sea - side. To sum up, I would recommend this ("no frills") hotel for its good location, cleanliness and competitive prices, which makes it a good base to both visit Venice and enjoy its beaches, but not if you are looking for a romantic and quite get-away.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing and friendly atmosphere, professional and courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireKenny
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is on the Lido, which suited us, being away from the hustle and bustle of the main island. This is reflected in the reasonably priced rooms. The air conditioned reception area has a lounge and small bar. Our room was very comfortable, with both air conditioning and ceiling fan. The bathroom was a good size, complete with bidet and a decent shower. The continental breakfast buffet was consistently good, the staff always attentive. We ate breakfast outside in the courtyard garden. Leaving the Hotel it is only 5 minutes walk to the vaperetto - a boat ride of about 15 minutes to the main island. A weekly ticket will cover you for all destinations and costs about 50 euros. After long days out sightseeing we returned to the Hotel to freshen up. Looking for somewhere to eat in the evening, leave the Hotel and turn right on to the main street, where you will find numerous good quality restaurants. To sum up, the Hotel Helvetia was a pleasant and comfortable experience.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in a super location.”
Reviews.Author: sunshinegirl67
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. Situated on the main street of the Lido with bars, cafes, ice cream stalls and shops on the doorstep. Two minutes to the vaporetto stop for boats to Venice (10-15 mins away) and a ten minute saunter to the beach. The beaches are free if you just want to put a towel down on the sand but for 13 Euros you can hire a lounger and umbrella for the day on the public beach at the top of the road. The hotel has an old fashioned charm but is spotlessly clean. My room was scrubbed to a shine when I returned every evening. The room was small and the bathroom tiny but it had everything I needed. Air con, fan, TV and hairdryer. Breakfast was much better than any other hotel I have stayed in in Italy. As a single woman holiday-maker, the hotel and location was great but it would also be perfect for families and couples. I asked for a quiet room and had a room at the rear. No nice view, but it was quiet. I would definitely recommend this hotel especially as it only cost Â£32 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: cazrox
Reviews.Content: I checked reviews for this Hotel before booking and was generally pleased with what I read so I went ahead and booked our family holiday. However, after booking I was starting to feel a little apprehensive when I read later reviews. How unneccessary!!!!!!! The hotel is perfectly based for anyone wishing to visit Venice and the lagoon islands. It is a 2 minute walk from the hotel to the vaporetto stop and then 10 minutes to San Marco. Route number 1 (which goes along the Grand Canal - stunning at night!) runs every 10 minutes up until 9pm and then approx every 20 minutes thereafter. Lido beach is about a 5-10 minute walk and was very clean (although watch out for the jellyfish during the hot weather as my daughter learnt to her detriment!!!) The hotel was extremely clean. The room was cleaned EVERY day and the bedding and towels were also changed daily. The room was a lovely size considering there were 4 beds and although it was facing the main road, we had a stunning view of St Marks from our bedroom window which more than made up for the noise!! Breakfast was very basic but adequate - it was a typical continental buffet of cold meats, cheese and croissants. It has a lovely courtyard where we had breakfast most mornings. ALL the staff were friendly, helpful, and polite. My family and I had a great time and can't fault our experience with this Hotel. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: changemaker
Reviews.Content: It's very clean, the staff are really, really helpful and it's got a nice spacious ground floor lobby/bar/restaurant/garden - much better than three stars I've been in on the Venice mainland. My friend and I were looking for a clean, plesant hotel that was really well placed for exploring Venice and the outlying islands and for doing the Biennale. It's just by the waterbus ferry with direct routes to St Mark's (10 mins), the Giardini (5 mins), the station, the airport and the islands as well as having a good supermarket, bank, shops and restaurants a minute's walk away and the beach 5 mins away. Evening views from the Lido across to Venice as the sun sets are stunning (not from the hotel itself but close). As a midprice option it's very good. Our rooms were small, it's true, but with spotless bathrooms and good air con so perfectly good as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the Lido”
Reviews.Author: docer
Reviews.Content: Definitly a good choice if you do not want to stay in the centre of venice. Lido is Quiter and has its own charm. I am not sure if one can get better deals for the same price but the hotel is definitly a good option if you are visiting venice for 2-3days. The ride to lido on the waterbuses is like a tourist boat ride in itself. Once you reach Lido the hotel is only 1minutes walk on the main road ( which is hidden behind a roundabout)

Reviews.Title: “Great beach location”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTCK
Reviews.Content: This is a great location. It is next to the beach away from core of Venice. To get to St. Marco Square - take the ferry that runs 24 hours a day and only takes 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Normal, not that great, think we shud have got it cheaper”
Reviews.Author: Manoj-Manju
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok ok, not that great... we got room 14. I noticed there wasn't any room numbered 13. They said, you would hardly find room 13 in Venice hotels. Anyway, the room was too small, a bit stinking as if the carpets were very old. But I am told that most of the hotels in Venice have that little bit of stinking smell bcoz of it being a water city / island. The area (i.e. Lido) is superb and safe. It's about 10 mins in water bus from the Venice city centre i.e. St Mark Square. I enjoyed being on Lido especially in evenings when you see all these Italian restaurants on the same street where Hotel Helvetia is. The staff was good. Limited choice for breakfast - no egg / omelette, even if you wanted to pay (not sure if that's always the case). The contitental breakfast included only 1 or 2 types of cereals, milk, yoghurt, some crossiants, cheese and i think only 1 type of juice (which always runs out if you are late) and some cake. Anyway, the bottom line is that we paid EUR 100 per night for such a small room. The room is worth EUR 60 if I see as per UK standards... unless Venice is expensive as compared to UK. So I would say if you can get rooms for about EUR 60-80, then better... not worth EUR 100.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, 3 star hotel on Lido near Venice”
Reviews.Author: acb5870
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as had stayed in Venice itself a couple of times before and decided to stay on Lido for a change and because a lot cheaper. The Helvetia was pretty good and no complaints at all. It was a budget option for us compared to normal but it was nice to see Lido where life is a bit slower than Venice - yet St Mark's vaporetto stop is reached in about 10 minutes from Lido so no problems there. The staff were accommodating when required, the room was clean and there was cafes and restaurants about although we spent most of our time in Venice itself. If you can or are willing to stay outwith Venice island then this is a great budget option.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to St Mark's Square area”
Reviews.Author: srh10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent, great location on the lido, only 10-15 miutes away by vaporetto to the main 'touristy' part of Venice, although the Lido itself was also nice. Cheaper restaurants and shops and fantastic, frequent vaporetto service. The hotel was dated but charming, good value for money and good breakfast. Have recommended to others.
